timeline.bodyText: Does this mean user should bump the version in gradle.properties before running this?  If so, document that.
timeline.author: karthikbalasub
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,9 @@
+Usage: ./scripts/bump-changelog [OPTION]...
+Moves everything under the "Unreleased" heading of the changelog to a new version heading based on the version number

replies.bodyText:
Yes, and I'll make sure this is explicitly stated. I'll also explicitly state this in the dev guide.
As for the naming, I chose bump-changelog because it should only be used when bumping to a new version, however update-changelog would make more sense to whoever is using it. I'll change it, and I'll also ensure that if someone tries to run it when not bumping the project version, it'll explain to them that the script is only needed when bumping the project version.
replies.author: evanw555

timeline.message:
Add new changelog

Replaces the old changelog with a new changelog conforming to the
"keep-a-changelog" standard, along with convenient links for seeing
which commits are included in each release. Adds a helper script for
updating the changelog and adding links as necessary. Also adds a check
in the Travis build script to ensure that it's updated.
